title: Define Project Scope and Requirements
description: Detailed requirements for the ContinuousLearningCompanion project are being gathered and documented. These include: target audience (employees), desired features (personalization, progress tracking, recommended content), expected outcomes (increased employee engagement, improved knowledge retention), data sources (APIs from learning platforms, company databases), integrations (with existing HR systems and collaboration tools), security considerations (data privacy, secure access, authentication), scalability requirements (performance under heavy load), technical specifications (real-time processing, offline capabilities), design constraints (user-friendly interface, mobile compatibility), and any additional requirements. Upon completion, these will be compiled into a comprehensive project scope document. The task has been reviewed by the code-architect and suggested improvements are as follows: add 'real-time processing' and 'offline capabilities' under technical specifications and consider adding 'mobile compatibility' under design constraints.

title: Design System Architecture
description: Design the overall system architecture, including the components, data flow, integration points, and key considerations such as scalability, maintainability, security, and performance. The architecture should include the following components: a web application (frontend), a backend API, a database, a recommendation engine, a content management system, and a notification system. Consider the integration with existing learning management systems (LMS) or content providers. Address data privacy and security concerns, as well as scalability requirements for handling a large number of users and content. Also, outline strategies to ensure the system's accessibility and compatibility across various devices and platforms, emphasizing on progressively enhanced web applications for cross-browser compatibility. Discuss the use of microservices architecture for better modularity and scalability. Lastly, detail how the system will be designed to comply with relevant accessibility standards (WCAG 2.1) and performance best practices.
